resources.string:
Hi, my name is Aleks. 

I love fish. 

The kind that is alive and swims around in an aquarium or river, or a lake, and definitely the ocean. Fun fact is that I have several aquariums and also a river. 

I like eating fish, too. Raw fish. Grilled fish. Smoked fish. Poached fish - not so much. And sometimes I even go fishing. And even less sometimes, I actually catch something. 

Once, when I was camping in Canada, and very hungry, I even caught a large salmon with my hands. 

I'll be happy to teach you how to make your own aquarium. You should ask someone else about fishing, though.

When I was a child my family used to spend the month of August in the San Juan mountains of Colorado. Back then there was no limits on the number of trout you could catch and we would eat all the trout we could eat three meals a day. There is no meal better than fresh caught trout dipped in corn meal and fried over an open camp fire. My mother especially liked the fact that trout have no scales that needed to be removed, and the skin of the fried trout had to be one of the tastiest parts of the dish.\n

Today they have only "catch and release" for trout in Colorado. What a sick idea, you torture the beast with a hook in his mouth and then release him. Where is the pleasure in that? On the plus side it probably makes the fish more challenging to catch as time goes on, though I have heard it said that fish have only a ten second memory so they might never learn a thing from the experience.
